abstract: The business is to be acquired by a consortium including Deutsche Bank and the private equity firms Värde Partners and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts.
snippet: The business is to be acquired by a consortium including Deutsche Bank and the private equity firms Värde Partners and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — GE Capital, the financing arm of General Electric, has agreed to sell its consumer lending business in Australia and New Zealand in a deal that values the business at 8.2 billion Australian dollars, or about $6.3 billion.

headline.main: GE Capital Agrees to Sell Australia and New Zealand Operations for $6.3 Billion
headline.print_headline: GE Capital Agrees to Sell Australia and New Zealand Operations for $6.3 Billion
